subject: how to spell words with /tS/
msgSnippet: I am editing a large word base right now, generated from getting phonetical pronunciations from words, and I keep coming across words like branch and beach
messageBody:
I am editing a large word base right now, generated from getting phonetical pronunciations from words, and I keep coming across words like "branch" and "beach" which my program has transliterated, according to the pronunciations, as /bratS/ and /bits/. This seems wrong. It seems they should be spelled /brac/ and /bitc/.

Paul

I am editing a large word base right now, generated from getting
phonetical pronunciations from words, and I keep coming across words
like "branch" and "beach" which my program has transliterated,
according to the pronunciations, as /<font face="Thoth Sampa">bratS</font>/
and /<font face="Thoth Sampa">bits</font>/. This seems wrong. It seems
they should be spelled /<font face="Thoth Sampa">brac</font>/ and /<font
 face="Thoth Sampa">bitc</font>/.<br>
<br>
Paul<br>
</body>
</html>
